content.description: The climb starts with some excellent technical climbing on slightly overhanging terrain. There are a few crux sections here separated by decent shakes. The angle eases off slightly below the overhang. After resting up, execute one last powerful sequence where the climb gets steep. Afterwards, trend right towards the anchors on much easier climbing through the overhang along some spooky, hollow rock.Excellent movement and a nice pump marred by a section of garbage rock at the start of the overhang. Have your belayer wear a helmet and stand close to the wall while climbing through the upper section.
content.protection: 19 very closely spaced bolts to lower-off anchors. As of Jan 2022, there were draws hanging on all but one bolt which could easily be skipped.
content.location: Middle of the light-colored panel. Easily identified by a rightwards finish through a blocky overhang.

content.description: This wall is around the corner from Money Left and starts just to the right of a big, chossy cave. There is a great panel of gently overhanging, lighter colored rock with steeper endings. This panel contains the hardest routes in the area. The far right side of the wall has a few 5.11s on slightly less steep terrain.
